Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2008 12:56PM nowwhat wrote: I too am having this. I have been trying to move the arm normally anyway. I have been exercising some, and it seems to have gotten better in some places, and worse in others, Now I feel some on my side back too.
Posts.Title: arm pain after bm ophelia pdm

Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2008 12:38PM nowwhat wrote: Binney, thanks for telling me NO hot. I did try some heat last night, and it did seem to help some. I'll make sure it isn't hot. Maria, it does feel like a cord in my lower arm. I have been doing the wall walks and putting my arm up straight above me head several times. It seems like nerves too. Now I feel some on my chest above the mastectomy scar. That tingle burn feeling. It sure helps to share and talk about this.
Posts.Title: arm pain after bm ophelia pdm

Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2008 04:08PM nowwhat wrote: I had a radical mastectomy on my left side in Jan.  I began to feel small lumps on the same side, above where my breast had been, but in that fatty area by my arm. My oncolgist felt it, and did not know what it might be, so to be sure, I just had a sonogram on the whole area. Thank God nothing was found. I have no area that would have fit in a machine for a mammogram!!
Posts.Title: A mammogram on a non-reconstructed chest wall??? otter otter

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2008 12:28PM nowwhat wrote: Well, I got the full pathology report Weds. I do NOT have clear margines, so will be doing radiation after chemo. I see the oncologist Feb 21, and will know what cocktail and how often. I am learning so much from all you brave ladies starting before me. My prayers are with you all.
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2008 02:57PM nowwhat wrote: So many of you  have already started this journey. I have to wait to see the oncologist on Feb 21. I wish I know how long, how often, and what cocktail.  I want to thank everyone for sharing what they are feeling and reacting. It helps me not to be so fearful. I rally do NOT want a port. But have small, slipery viens. I am praying that I can get by without one.

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2008 04:06PM nowwhat wrote: Bridget and Nolana, I am so understanding what you are both going thru. I cry one min ute, freak out the next, and am calm and resolved the next. You both seem to be starting Thursday. You are in my prayers. I am like you, I have a lot of drig allergies, and am so afraid of having bad reactions during and after chemo. I was going to go along to it, but think I'll ask my adult son or daughter to go with me the first 2 times.  I see the oncologist Thursday to see when mine starts and what drugs.  UGH! Thursday is a bit day. I know grannie starts hers soon too. Krista and Donna, I hope that you are both feeling better. Drink fluids and rest. Aurora, post us a picture of your new look. I'll share when I shave mine. I bet you look wonderful.  Been fighting a sore throat and cough here. I want it gone by the time I start this wage of war.  Hugs to the Fabulous Febuary Fighters!!

Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Feb 14, 2008 06:18PM nowwhat wrote: Nolana, I am also fearing the unknown. But it so helps to come here and read everyone's comments. The ladies before us have helped calm me. Saying it wasn't that bad. Not as bad as imagined, That's what helps me cope. Yes, I still cry every now and then. I am really trying to get thru this with humor. Laughter is GOOD Medicine. I bought a book off Amazon called, "I'd rather do Chemo than clean out the garage". It's cute. I also kid with my daughtre who is 28. I told her I was going to get a tattoo on my chest that read "Boob" and a nipple in the middle tattooed. She said It should read, "Blow to inflate". I laughted so hard!!  So, family, God, humor, and friends are getting me through this! Come here and share. I am like grannie. I think I'll end up starting in march, but want to stay with the Feb. gals because that's who I am getting to know. I see my oncologist Feb 21 to see when we start. Hugs
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2008 03:37PM nowwhat wrote: We could be the Feb Fighters. We are fighting this dang Breast Cancer!!! Nolana, I am glad that you appreciated my daughters comment. LOL! I hope that you ladies who are feeling the tummy rumbles will settle soon. I am feeling a little overwelmed today. Not sure why, or what triggered it. I am just kind of crying here and there, and feeling sad. I think it's the stress of knowing that chemo is getting closer, and I have no control. I am trying to be prepared. I got Biotene toothpast and mouth wash to help prevent sores in the mouth. I stocked up on popcicles, potatoes, crackers, etc. I have even started packing a small chemo bag to take with life savers, chapstick, MP3 player, flavored water, a book, etc. I KNOW God will see me through. I just have to keep saying to myself "Fear NOT, for I am with you".   I really dislike feeling so low.
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2008 03:46PM nowwhat wrote: You ladies have been busy. Laura, thanks for explaining what the neulasta shot is for. I hope I can do one shot instead of 7 of neupogen. I cry at the drop of a hat. Hon, let it out. It's okay that we feel and cry. That's normal grieving. We are all grieving our lives before cancer. It's okay. Bridget, have your friend the dog groomer do a poodle cut before she does bald and take pcitures. <grin>  You could wear your wig sideways to the resturant and get bigger tips yet. <wink> I hope that you can go ahead with the chemo and not have to remove your expanders. Sorry that you are still having so much pain. I still sleep half sitting up, I had mastectomy and lymph nodes removed. Laura, welcome. Emend is suppose to be a very effective anti nausea drug. I am going to ask the oncologist about it tomorrow. It has helped em so much to read here and feel more prepared as to what is within normal range of side effect. I hope it will help me not freak out over things. I do read that it's cumulative, but that treatment 1 & 2 seem to be the hardest.  Mom son who lives in San Fransico, has offered to bring me some medical marijuana. Me, Ms. straight who doesn't even drink! LOL! But I never say never... Patricia, I'll have to check out "I wore lipstick to my mastectomy". Your picture is GORGEOUS!!!!!!! Grannie, what a sweetie your GD is. I would love to read more sayings. Let us know what the surgeon says about your port. Nolana, That's so good that you have company with your mom and DH for infusion. My daughter has said she'll go with me. I was going to go alone, but am starting to get chicken and scared of the unknown.  Ladies, cry if you need too. It's OKAY!!!  WE cry for what might have been, we cry because of what could be, we cry for the what if's. It's OKAY!!  We are allowed to grieve. It's normal and natural. Aurora, I LOVE the bible scriptures! He is what gets me thru each day. I hope that your wig arrives soon. I love the new picture! I see the oncologist tomorrow morning. Here I go........... Gail

Posts.Content: Jan 25, 2008 11:46AM nowwhat wrote: Ladies, it's so nice to have you all here supporting each other. I HATE that we are having to deal with cancer, but we can support each other thru this journey. I am also a momma who had very long hair my whole life. My kids would grab a hunk and hold it like a blankie to go to sleep. I just got a very short shag cut to be prepared. My neck and ears are freezing!  Breast cancer runs in my family. My maternal grandma, maternal aunt, and mom have all had it. But in the back of my mind, I really didn't believe I woule REALLY get it.  I have 5 bio children and have adopted 4 children. I HAVE to beat this and raise my little ones still home. My 3 yr old doesn't let me out of his sight. This is going to hardest on him.
Posts.Title: Chemo starting Feb 2008? nowwhat cancerviking

Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2008 06:08PM nowwhat wrote: Dean15, good luck with your first treatment. Please let us know how you are doing. We are all going to be going thru it too. Drink water!!!!!

I see my surgeon tomorrow for the drain to be taken out of my mastectomy, and will get the pathology report. I want to get into the oncologist and KNOW what I will be taking, when, and for how long! Tammy, how ar you feeling today?? I really like what the Jan jewels have on their site. It's FUBC! That's my new motto!

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2008 08:39PM nowwhat wrote: Aurora, thanks for the hink on the butterfly needles. I have small viens and hope to get thru this without a port. And my hands are always cold, so I WILL pack mittens. Patricia, I am impressed that you are playing tennis. I hope your 2nd tx goes as well for you.  I still laugh everytime I think of my daughter saying tatoo "blow to inflate". LOL!! Bridget, you have time for reconstruction later. Now is the time to get better. We ARE Febuary Fighters! We ARE in this to WIN!! I am going to be doing chemo and rads too. We are gonna get those little suckers! Nolana, I am sending a hug right back at ya. I have been feeling better today. I had some of my older children come here and 19 of us went out for Chinese buffet. Hey, I have to enjoy food while I can still taste it. Just feeling all their love and support helps me feel strong again. I hope all you BC sisters are doing well this week-end. God bless us all. Gail

Posts.Content: Feb 21, 2008 07:38PM nowwhat wrote: Well ladies, I will not be joining you all Fabulous Febuary Fighters. I did go to see the oncologist today. He is putting me on an estrogen inhibitor for 5 years, with NO Chemo, and NO radiation!! He feels that the surgeon got all the cancer, and with no node involvement, he is confident to just go with this. I will see him every 3 months and be watched closely. I could have side effects from the meds, but nothing like chemo!  I guess I can be a cheerleader for the Fabulous feb fighters! You ladies are all so wonderful. If you don't mind, I'd still like to stay here and share with you all. I am numb with his diagnoisis. The surgeon had told me chemo and radiation. That he had NOT gotten clean margins. Oncologist looked a second time in front of me, reading the pathology report, and said, that's why HE is a surgeon, and I am an oncologist. LOL!  I am stunned.  I have my wigs ready, my chemo bag packed, and dinners frozen. I just keep pinching myself.............
